intro: Cyclea barbata, commonly known as the hairy nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its small, spiny stems and clusters of violet or purple flowers. Its leaves are typically hairy, giving it the common name, and it produces small, berry-like fruits. Cyclea barbata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
